comment: Super easy! Study your notes, come to class, read the assigned books, make an A.  Tests are verbatim from the notes, so COME TO CLASS!

BAD professor. I love history and am usually pretty good at it and she went out of her way to  make things complicated. Nice to you individually but reads straight from the notes with no enthusiasm. Very boring and unfair. I do not recommend this professor.

I am a junior and she is the worst teacher I have had so far. Reads straight from the notes, tests over very specific content & not the broad picture. We read 4 books with one book review, which was graded hard. I'm a pretty good student who studies for tests and does my homework & I'm about to make a D in this class! RUN!

She is very boring and dry. If you want to learn about Native Americans take this class if not RUN! She reads her notes word for word, which makes the class very dull.She has no idea what she is talking about. You won't learn a thing and test questions are random and from out of nowhere. If you have any interest in enjoying class don't take this.

Class is super boring. She says she talks super fast and you may need her to slow down but that's a lie she talks super slow and thinks she is from the South but talks like she is from the North. She makes you read four books no textbook though. I already don't care for history and she made it worse. I would NOT recommend this teacher!

She lectures right from the notes. Study those and you'll be good for the quiz. If she gives you a study guide, MEMORIZE IT. Quizzes were easy, exams were much harder than expected. Half of the questions on the final were from the books. I would NOT recommend her to anyone, whether you actually like learning about History or not.
She does not take attendance. Only good thing about her class.

She teaches straight from her notes, her midterm wasn't what she described before hand. She puts handouts on Vista for the class. There is no book required. She got off topic alot in my class, so we were tested on things that we hadn't covered much on.

VERY BORING!! Not too difficult, but she is boring,no need to read the books, just use spark notes for the three test questions about each book. DON'T TAKE if you fall asleep easily or if you actually want to learn something.

She can be extremely boring most of the time. She shows movies that you will be quizzed on. Her notes have little to do with quiz and test questions. But the tests are still easy. If you don't mind how slow she can talk and want the easy A or B then take her.
If you want an easy "A" then go for it. If you want to have fun while learning history RUN!
She teaches straight from her notes, but the class is easy!

The most boring history teacher I have ever had. She think she talks fast, but actually talks slow. She thinks she has a southern accent, but actually talks like she is from the North. Lectures from the overhead the ENTIRE class period. I like history and she made this class a DRAG. Also, 4 required book readings. Don't waste your time.

She is extremely boring. She talks slower than anyone I've ever heard, yet she thinks she talks fast. She makes up answers to the tests and quizzes and isn't very lenient even if the whole class agrees with you. She's not too hard if you do the reading and take notes in class. Her notes are weird to study though. If you have no other options, do it

Teaches by reading her notes to class.  Could not answer any questions posed to her that were not covered in her notes.  Her test were ridiculous - filled with errors and on obscure details barely touched on in class.  Nice lady, but no business teaching.

Without a doubt the worst class I've ever had to take. We spent nearly a month talking about Wounded Knee. There were four books assigned for reading and we had at the most two questions about them on the tests; the last book was never even mentioned. Don't waste your time. She isn't helpful and I'm not convinced that she even knows the material.

She really is a nice person, but extremely boring. I am convinced that she has no idea what she's talking about, as she reads her lectures line by line from notes and gets confused easily. Don't trust the "book quizzes." They are mostly on lecture material, with approx. 3 or 4 questions on the novel.

Ugh! Where do I begin..nice lady.  Other words that come to mind:  Boring, poor communication skills, unclear, and unorganized.  We read four books in this class which were barely mentioned but tested on.  She doesn't use WebCt or email to communicate so you're screwed if she makes any changes to the schedule. Overall: Very disappointed, run!

If you come to class take notes and pay attention, you should have no trouble passing this class with flying colors. Yes she does jump around a little and is a little boring, but that is the case with most prof's anyway. The books are nice, you can check them out from the library and waste no money. They are easy reads, much better than text books

nice lady, but lectures are extremely long and boring. 2 tests and 4 quizzes. Read 4 novels. quizzes come straight from lecture so they are extremely easy. gives extra credit through attending a event and writing a paper. a LOT of wrting.

This professor is absolutely terrible. Half of the books that she requires are not documented through the university.  She has a personal agenda that she teaches about Native American Culture.  The actual class material that is part of the curriculum she reads off line by line with no class interaction or explanation. AVOID. HUGE MISTAKE.

If you have a hard time concentrating in class, she is not the professor for you. Lectures every class. Very boring.Pauses constantly. Come to class and write down every word she says and you will get an A. 2 test and 4 book quizzes. An extra credit paper. Easy A, but you won't learn anything.

Her lectures are very long and boring, but if you are good at taking notes then you'll do fine.  Her tests are fair and everything comes from notes. Tests are True/False, multiple choice and short answers.
Tests were hard and had tricky questions with answers to throw you off

Yes her lectures are boring and drawn out and sometimes hard to follow, but she gives you all of the  information and then some that you could possibly need to make an easy A in this class. I can honestly say I would take her class again. If you take her class, buy a laptop and learn to type. Attendance is also important to get through it.

The class is not hard she is just EXTREMELY BORING!!! For me it was hard to pay attention because she talks in monotone the whoale time and reads the whole chapter back to you that you were supposed to read before class. There are 3 test multiple choice. She is a nice lady just boring.

Probably the worst professor I have had in four years of college.  Her test questions are very ambiguous and on many there is more than one answer that could be correct.  You have to choose the answer that she thinks is correct. She lectures the whole time from her notes, jumps around a lot and talks very fast. Hand cramps are a regular occurrence.
Great professor, tests fair, multiple choice and true false.  Pay attention to her lectures.

I like the assigned books. There better than the average boring textbooks. Two of the are eyewitness accounts of the Vietnam War, one is a novel and the other is a compilation of essays on Native Americans. She is a little dry in lecture but very thourough and clear. I would recommend her to someone who wants an easy and relaxed class.

The class subject is History 2110; however, It felt like it was a Literature class. She makes the class read stupid books that has nothing to do with history at all. Her tests are confusing. Her lectures are too long and very boring. Do not take this class ever. Find another professor.
